xxl.applications.indexStructures
Class BTreeExample

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.indexStructures.BTreeExample

public class BTreeExample
extends Object

Example code concerning the creation and reopening of B+-Trees. A class named Data models the objects to be inserted into the B+-Tree. To be able to store objects of class Data to disk and read them back into memory, a Converter named objectConverter is provided. The attributes of Data to be indexed are name and age. Therefore A tailor-cut class Key only consists of those two attributes. Because keys have also to be written to disk, Key implements the interface Convertable. In case of B+-Trees, keys also have to be comparable, so the class Key implements the appropriate interface Comparable. The Function getDescriptor implements how to obtain a key from a Data object. This function is called by the B+-Tree each time when an object is inserted into the tree. Three static methods, createBTree, closeBTree and openBTree allow to work with B+-Trees more easily and can be used without any modification:

  • createBTree(String, int, Buffer, Function, int, Converter, int, Converter, Comparator) creates a new BTree.
  • closeBTree(BTree, String, Converter, Comparator) closes (and saves) the BTree.
  • openBTree(String, Buffer, Function, Converter, Converter, Comparator) reopens the BTree from disk.
Besides the converters, comparator and functions mentioned above, some more parameters are needed by those three methods. The tree must have a name which will be used as a prefix for the files containing the B+-Tree data. Furthermore, the method createBTree needs to know how many bytes are needed maximally to store keys and objects (of class Data) on disk.

A converter suitable for Descriptors.

Parameters:
borderConverter - a Converter for borders used in the descriptor
comparator - a comparator suitable for descriptors
Returns:
a converter suitable for Descriptors

public static BTree createBTree(String treeName,
                                int blockSize,
                                Buffer buffer,
                                Function getDescriptor,
                                int objectSize,
                                Converter objectConverter,
                                int borderSize,
                                Converter borderConverter,
                                Comparator comparator)
                         throws Exception
Creates a new BTree

Parameters:
treeName - a name for the tree
blockSize - the size reserved for storing a block in the used container
buffer - the buffer to use
getDescriptor - function computing a descriptor for a given object
objectSize - size of the objects stored in the tree in bytes
objectConverter - a converter for objects stored in the tree
borderSize - size of borders used in the tree
borderConverter - a converter for borders used in the tree
comparator - comparator for borders used in the tree
Returns:
the created BTree
Throws:
Exception

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
The main method inserts 100000 elements into a new BTree, closes and reopens it and counts the contained elements.
